website_summaries.verdict: These binoculars are designed for the avid birder or outdoorsman, but their high price tag makes them impractical for the casual observer.
pros: Compact binoculars that are perfect for traveling
Close focus enables you to examine the details of plants, birds, and other objects
cons: These binoculars are pricey and may not be worth the investment unless you plan to use them regularly

website_summaries.verdict: A mid-sized pair of binoculars for mid-range price that are built for stashing in a bag and hitting the trails.
pros: Lightweight and fairly compact, so they are easy to carry

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof and customer service doesn't exist!!
customer_reviews.text: If I had reviewed this yesterday - 4 stars as a very good moderately priced birding binocular. However, it is supposed to be waterproof. It was on my patio table, under a pergola during a little rain we had. Not immersed, just some rain. The right lens is totally ruined with water inside. Customer service and supposed warranty?? Who knows? Nobody at their customer service. On automation for 2 hours and still waiting. You can get your kicks on route 66. Total nonsense. Should have known, in spite of the accolades, this product is made in China and is a piece of garbage and there is no company to back it up.
customer_reviews.author: Aged Runner

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value with comparable quality to binoculars twice the price
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered a second pair of the Nature DX 8x32. I had purchased this along with Wirecutter's recommended TrailSeeker 8x42 to compare. While the TrailSeeker had a nice carrying case and accessories, I just couldn't see a big enough difference to justify the more than twice the price to upgrade for what was supposed to be more light and larger field of view. Both were great, but the Nature DX 8x32 is an outstanding value. So much so that I've ordered a second for our trip to the Grand Tetons.
customer_reviews.author: M. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: UNABLE TO FOCUS
customer_reviews.text: After reading all positive reviews I came to the conclusion that this is the correct product to purchase. Unfortunately the one I got came with the lenses our of focus and I was unable to corrected it or focus in all possible positions. Nice looking binoculars, great material, but they did not work for me. Many got lucky and got them in perfect conditions, well that was not my case. Amazon offered change or talk to an expert but I got skeptical and frustrated that after looking and researching for the product I got something defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: Just coming off safari. Outstanding binoculars. I took some iPhone photos through one side of the binos. A little crude but effective.
customer_reviews.author: Cwlovell

customer_reviews.title: great nocs for waterproof and clarity
customer_reviews.text: Very little shake and super light weight. These are very easy to carry with and use every day. I had them on me at all times for two and half weeks in Alaska and they worked great the whole time. I was able to fairly quickly adjust for clarity and dimension, but it did take some getting used to. I recommend using them for a few days before using them on a trip to get used to the roll.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to donate to my granddaughter's school so her 5th grade teacher could try to get a grant to get enough for the whole class. My usual binoculars cost over $500 and these compared very favorably to those, with similar eye relief with glasses, similar sharpness and contrast, and the Celestrons had closer focus for insects and wider field of view than my binocs. The compact size, ease of focusing, and light weight are perfect for kid's hands. It's amazing that these cost less than $100!
customer_reviews.author: P. Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE MOLD SMELL
customer_reviews.text: I took these out of the package and they reeked of mold smell. Even the plastic bags the items come in smell. I didn't have a chance to try them out because when I put them up to my eyes the mold smell was overpowering. YUCK! I repackaged them and washed my hands immediately. The box says they were made in 2014 - I wonder where they have been all this time.....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stinchfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Binos--Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This item showed up in a review article in "The Living Bird" published by the Cornell Laboratory of Ornithology.as the best binoculars available in the "bargain price range" in a review of several brands. I've had a Celestron spotting scope for 40 years, and never been disappointed with it. I wanted to replace my ageing binoculars, and Amazon's price for these was unbeatable--even a greater bargain than suggested by the Cornell Lab review. The review was correct. The images are the usual Celestron quality. The binoculars are relatively light-weight, the field of focus is excellent, especially for bird-watching, the adjustments are easily accomplished, and the lens covers and case are very utilitarian. An excellent product at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Orr

customer_reviews.title: I like these binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: I went on the Audubon site to see what field glasses to buy as I begin my birding adventure. These were the least expensive pair. They mentioned that they passed them out at a convention and many people selected them as the best choice. I was on a birding outing the other day and tried everyone's glasses. This pair measured up to all of them, some of which cost hundreds.
customer_reviews.author: Knownasjim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect binocular
customer_reviews.text: I own at least 30 binoculars, most expensive/renowned. First impression is that this 8 x 42 can't be beaten. Bright, fine focus to the edge of field. FULLY multicoated lenses, phase coatings on prisms ALL very important to yield such bright and sharp focus. Center focus is perfect, not to stiff. less stiff focus leads to accidentally going out of focus. HINT: keep both fingers on center focus. For the price, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Ux4

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer, but doesn't beat my Leupold
customer_reviews.text: Something about it does not feel like a five star rating, but I can't really articulate it exactly. It is a bit heavy but this is also a bit larger than my other binocs. I have a $350 10x50 Leupold binocs that I love, and this just does not compare. I would like to have evaluated the 8x56 model also. I need to do some star gazing to compare the light-gathering properties. However I'm satisfied to keep it. Later I bought a Barska tripod mount and it would not fit this and had to return the mount - the mount knob won't fit between the large lenses to be able to turn and seat properly with room for adjustment. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: DeRavenSey

customer_reviews.title: Great value set of binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, and light for its quality. It's just as good as the Vortex Crossfire I recently purchased, but about 3/4ths the length and about 2/3rds the price. Vortex does have a reputation for an outstanding unlimited warranty. The adjustments on this are easier to make compared to the Crossfire, whose controls feel stiff in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Mazdafun

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for a Basic pair of binoculars
customer_reviews.text: So I had recently purchased a pair of Swarovski 8x42, and was curious how they would compare to these well reviewed but much less expensive Celestrons. I also have a pair of Celestron 20X80, and knew they made decent binoculars. These Celestron 8x42s are good basic binoculars and an amazing value at their price point. Light and compact, clear and easy focus, they are now my "upstairs grab" bincoculars to check things out. If you can spend a little more, I would go for Nikon or Vortex, but you won't be disappointed if you go for these Celestrons.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleasantly Surprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for bird and wildlife watching. I was amazed immediately by how bright and clear the image is with these for the price. I had done a lot of research and held off purchasing but these had a price drop and I pulled the trigger. Happy I did! They feel solid and operate smoothly, heavier than I would have expected at this price point so I'll be looking for a different strap. And did I say BRIGHT! Think I'll be getting a second pair soon to gift!
customer_reviews.author: MyKix

customer_reviews.title: Really good entry level binos for birding
customer_reviews.text: The Audobon Society recommends these in the entry level category, but my eyes can't distinguish them from the Nikon 7540 (intermediate level) I bought for someone else. Perhaps more critical users will differ, but these are great for casual birders and are quite affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Knoll

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of binos
customer_reviews.text: 50 year birder with many pairs of binos. These have become my go-to over my much more expensive brands because they are so crisp and I don't feel like I have to walk on eggshells when I'm using them. What a great inexpensive pair of quality glasses. Great pair if you want to get a young person started birding. My grandparents got me my first pair when I was 9, along with my first Peterson's field guide. Been keeping my life list since and now have almost 500!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: They are absolutely fantastic! I zoomed in on a merlin far away
customer_reviews.text: I used my binoculars the day after I received them. Wow! They are absolutely fantastic! I zoomed in on a merlin far away, obscured by branches, and could watch it preening. I never realized how much I was missing with my older binoculars. The price was excellent! The strap that comes with them is quite minimal, but it was great to have it so I could get started right away. I love the case!
customer_reviews.author: Heather FL

customer_reviews.title: Great birding glasses for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are hard to find fault with for the price. As a beginning birder they've done everything I have expected them to do. The only feature I have found lacking so far is micro adjustable eye relief. There are two click settings, and you can fine tune between those, but I find that I have to fiddle with them now and then to align my viewing angle with the image. That was frustrating at first because I didn't know what was causing the tunnel vision issue. Once I figured it out it's only mildly annoying. Also it's only a potential issue if you where glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, but...
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable clarity and resolution, quite like binocs costing much, much more. I tried these with 10X Swarovski $2,500 binocs and could not discern any difference. If you want great glasses for not much money, these are it. There's a reason Audubon rated them so highly. However, the diopter adjuster is VERY stiff and gets more stiff with time. I have three of these bino's that I keep in different vehicles or locations, and all are the same. Celestron needs to work on this. Other than this, I'd rate these five star.
customer_reviews.author: Biplaner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT IMAGE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these binoculars for a while now to spy on my now ex-wife. The image quality is amazing I can clearly see her mole and the hair coming out of it. Using this , I have been able to identify all the men that she’s been seeing behind my back. Thanks to this, my marriage is ruined and our children now up for adoption. I am happy to say that these Celesteon Nature 8x42 Binoculars helped me realize the skank that this woman actually is. 1 like = 1 prayer
customer_reviews.author: Mywifecheatedonme

customer_reviews.title: These are a Great set of Binoculars, a great deal and do a super job
customer_reviews.text: I really love there Binoculars, they do an amazing job. I wanted a pair for Birding and was looking at reviews for all the different brands in this size 8x42. I was amazed at the variation of prices and similarity of products. I read outstanding reviews on this pair in many places, and many people felt that they were a very good pair and were on par with more expensive ones. I decided that I'd try them and if unhappy I'd return them and get one of the more expensive pairs. well, I'm not returning anything I really love them as a matter of fact I was looking at their spotting scopes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate my Nikons, and I just couldn't afford another at that price so opted for this brand. I am SO happy with this purchase. Absolutely just as good as my Nikon pair, if not better. Super comfortable and easy to operate. I wear glasses and my eyes are very different prescriptions, Whether they are on or off, I have no trouble focusing on things near or far. GREAT FOR BIRD WATCHING. I can't say enough. Also these were dropped in my pool. Completely waterproof, had no issues at all! FIVE STARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I’m totally amateur and am not used to using binoculars. I was able to focus on a grove of trees a fair distance away, in the fading light of day, and the edges of the leaves and the texture of the tree bark were sharp. I guess with a little experience with these, they will become better and better. All in all, a good quality build, nice solid feel but lightweight, and worth the price. A good toe dip into a new hobby. I suppose even for more experienced birders, these might even be acceptable if they were out for a casual look see.
customer_reviews.author: CAF

customer_reviews.title: clear
customer_reviews.text: Once you set them to your own vision they are an absolute pleasure to the eye. I am an aviation buff ,and spot aircraft at altitude alot . My last pair were smaller but more power. The view these give is hands down more clear and defined . They take a steady hand , but they pay off big.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brunelli

customer_reviews.title: high-quality binoculars
customer_reviews.text: The best feature for me is that they can be focused for each eye separately since my eyes have different acuity. The view is sharp and the colors true. I think that's because of the type of coating on the lens. They feel good in the hand and seem very well made. They come with a strap and a durable carry case. They don't have a camera attachment but I wasn't looking for that.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Audubon Equinox 10 x40’s for years but when I forgot to pack them on a recent summer trip to Montana, I needed a pair quick. I ordered these at the reasonable price if $120 and was VERY PLEASED with the quality and performance. An EXCELLENT introductory binocular.
customer_reviews.author: Scamper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful binoculars for an economy price. More than you have a right to expect!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of binoculars for the money! I did my research on major birding sites, and these were listed as top picks in 2013 for entry-level equipment. The reviews said the optics rivaled those of more expensive models, and I've found it to be true. They are lightweight, so easy to use over a long period. The focus adjustment is simple and highly responsive. I bought them for my son and he's thrilled with them. Pair them up with the Celestron 93577 binocular harness for a great setup!
customer_reviews.author: AnnainOK

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of inexpensive binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I took these on a recent Alaska cruise and they were awesome. First of all don't take an Alaskan cruise without binoculars. Second if you need a pair I'd highly recommend these. They are a good size and provide a clear view. It takes a bit of time to adjust them to your liking but after that you can see everything up close and crystal clear. The 8x42 suited our needs perfectly and the image was stable. They come with a nice case, a decent neck strap (although there are softer straps available), and covers for the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with these bino's. I got them for bird watching and to take on our cruise. They performed very well and I didn't have any issue with the eye relief.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: 10x42s are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: First, I ordered the 8x42s. I could not get a clear focus, nor could my husband. when we got home, I ordered the 10x42s. Glad I did, these are perfect. Great for birding on a budget. heck, great for birding. Easy to carry. Great optics. I think the 8s would be good for concerts or sporting events. Not a professional birder, but know when the view is better. Thank you, Amazon for allowing me to return the 8x42s. Both are a great size and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sweany

customer_reviews.title: great viewing the moon
customer_reviews.text: it's not a telescope but might as well consider it to be because the moon looks beautiful looking thru this great binocular with great price....everything looks really clear....vibrant colors seeing the trees...most of all the you can see all the details on a bird perched up really high on the tree....love love love this binocular....everyone should have one..it's also great gift for all occasion
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Bacher

customer_reviews.title: Great for Eyeglass Wearers
customer_reviews.text: My review comes from previous experience with less expensive, smaller powered binoculars (compact 8x25) that served me well - but it was time for an upgrade. So this pair - 8x42 - is a step up. I expected brighter and clearer images (which I got) but the best part is that with an Eye Relief of 17.5mm, I don't have to remove my glasses to get a good view! Very happy with these binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars for the Beginning Birder
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of binoculars (bins) that cost 5x the price of these and I could not get them to focus as sharp as these. I also prefer the weight and feel of these bins compared to my $500 bins and would easily recommend them for anyone's first pair of birding bins. It is often said that you need to spend $300 for a decent pair of birding bins. In my opinion, not so! The Celestron Nature DX 8x42 Bins are a great choice for beginning birders. I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: freestoneriver

customer_reviews.title: Broken eyepiece but otherwise quite nice
customer_reviews.text: My first proper binoculars! I like them so far, although I was disappointed that the eyepiece cover was defective such that the lanyard cannot be threaded through one of the loops (it is broken). I can't return or exchange the eyepiece cover because I'm going on safari next week, and the defect shouldn't impede use of the binoculars, but it's a bit worrying as an indication of quality.
customer_reviews.author: ItalyTraveler

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY: Celestron – Nature DX 8x42 Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of bino's to bird watch a bare tree branch across the street. Unfortunately, these are not strong enough. I didn't want to pay 2x what I paid for these for a stronger lens. I purchased a different brand that are 12x42 and they're not strong enough either. I also like the quality of Celestron very much. I keep checking for a really good pair with BAK4 and FMC lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Reezie

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of real binoculars. Had a cheap set I got as a gift years ago, and the difference between a cheap set and these is like night and day. On top of it, these are a great value. 8x42 is just perfect for a variety of uses. Let's in plenty of light in low light situations, enough magnification for any use. Light, small, and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good binoculars. I have seen better, but only for twice the price or more. The only problem I have with them is zeroing in on a subject, I have to take my time and then the subject has moved...
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough for the purpose
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and compact, the optics are good, enough for general birdwatching. The right eyecup is loose, does not stay in extended position, requiring the need to check and re-adjust too frequently. Yet, the diopter adjustment ring behind it is almost too tight, requires a bit too much effort to turn. Fortunately, that is not a frequent need, unless multiple users. All in all, not bad, not great, adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Old Corps

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bird watching, great sharpness, but with white birds on a cloud background for example, you will see green and purple chroma on both sides of the bird. If this offends you, just spend another $900 on Leitz, Swarovski, etc. The rubberized coating is 10/10. Very comfortable and won't slip in your hands. Front and rear lens caps pop off without risk of falling off, well designed. Thoroughly enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Business owner

customer_reviews.title: PRAISES SPOT ON!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ALWAYS rely on product reviews to "tell the story" prior to making a purchase. The ones for these binoculars were "spot on"!!! These are the greatest! We are seniors who love going to concerts in addition to traveling. Also live on the ocean so a bird, mammal or boat or two are always a possibility! These are so bright, clear (ordered the 10x42) and compact! Will use them for many yrs to come! You will definitely NOT be disappointed for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Feet

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to be excellent birding binoculars, but the pair I received were very messed up - lens out of alignment. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L. Dough

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a first time birder looking for something decent. I did lots of research and these seemed to be the consensus for " good quality, don't go cheaper than this". They are amazing. The picture is clear, field of view excellent. Waterproof quality proven the first day I used them and it rained for two hours. There is no need to spend big money when these are available.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Shreve

customer_reviews.title: Good for a beginner bird watcher
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just recently gotten into birding and my gosh, do these enhance the experience. I’ve ID’d way more birds since getting these and just overall enjoy birding more. Definitely good for a beginner bird watcher
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, bright, and clear.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly decent, bright and sharp binos. Good feel in the hand. I have noticed some chromatic aberration though. It can't really go head-to-head the serios binos, but great for casual bird watching etc, and you don't have to stress out if it gets a nasty bump as the investment is small.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice binocs for under $200. Pentax was my go-to brand. I recently purchased a pair of 10x40s, as I have for years, and was disappointed with this one. There were problems vocusing sharply. The Pentax cost roughly $100 more then the Celestron. The Celestron has very nice optics, crisp vocusing and they're light weight.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fully-Featured Good, Not Great, Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are well-featured, well-built and have decent optics. They are a step up from cheapo $45 binoculars, but the clarity of the image does not match more expensive binoculars. Images are a bit washed out but relatively crisp. Not a whole lot of depth in images. The binoculars have twist-up eyecups -- a nice feature at this price point. The popular 8x42 model has a wide field of view, and there are other options in the Nature DX range. Waterproof construction with easy to grip surfaces. The hinged lens caps on the wider lenses is handy, and the case is decent. These are relatively heavy binoculars, but not outrageous. Good beginner binoculars, just don't expect stunning images.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love these binoculars! They are easy to focus even with my glasses on, have amazing clarity and are not too heavy. I took them on a trip that included several visits to a bird sanctuary. My experience was incredible. I can't wait to use them again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good clear view
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a cruise up the Alaska inside passage. I used these binoculars constantly. They were a pleasure to use. Good clear view, no distortions, easy to align. I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Red State

customer_reviews.title: Good Image, Lackluster Construction
customer_reviews.text: The image produced is good. I feel those components are well chosen for the price. The overall construction, however, may be lacking. One eye piece is now loose and will not hold any position. I have only had these for about 4 months. So that is disappointing. I read through the warranty info, and it does not seem worth the time, hassle, or money to try and have them fix them under that warranty. Overall, I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Simmons Family

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why I needed a binocular, but I liked it anyway.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be cool to have a binocular to look at things with kids. I decided on Celestron 71332 Nature DX 8x42 after some research. Very clear view, with decent magnification. It is light, easy to hold, and doesn't hurt your face. The strap could be better. The trees and bushes seem like in 2D, like graphics in computer games; I don't know it is same way with all binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Paca

customer_reviews.title: NEVER ORDER THIS PRODUCT ITS COMPONENTS ARE A PIECE OF ----
customer_reviews.text: This item although it may be a good set of binocs-- came with the ring protectors for the lenses ALREADY BROKEN. IT IS A PIECE OF CRAP. Don't bother ordering these binocs. The parts are junk. FIND A BETTER PAIR AND BUY DIRECT FROM ANOTHER PLACE. Amazon too zero responsibility for sending it out like this or for offering such junk.
customer_reviews.author: Flora Eyster

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: They work really well for the price in my opinion, i have looked through some very high end binoculars and when you spend several hundreds you certainly tell the difference but overall these feel like much more expensive and have enjoyed using them and have had others tell me they like them. I would recommend buying these as they are a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Serg

customer_reviews.title: Bright sharp optics and Celestron stands by their product
customer_reviews.text: I love these for birding and anytime I shared them with a colleague they had high praise for the comfort, brightness and optics. They are my go to binoculars for birding and boating. I had an issue after I had them for a while and the customer service people were outstanding to deal with and sent me a replacement. Definitely five star eperience.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Halliday

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars for Birding
customer_reviews.text: These took my birding to the next level. I am now able to much easier identify small, quick birds than with my old 7x35 binocs. I can see so many more details and colors as these let in so much light. Also the fact that they are waterproof and fogproof make these a great value. Very satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M A

customer_reviews.title: I'm an amateur binoculars user.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this as an amateur. It took me some time to understand how to adjust to my eye width, and to adjust lenses. I have nothing else to compare it. I use it for birds and deer, and other wildlife. I would like to get a binoculars for night sky viewing.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price. The view in low light situations is very clear. I wish I had a lens for my camera with that much capability. It’s easy to adjust. The eyepieces do move a bit but it’s not problematic. I can follow birds easily as the field of view is quite good. I would buy them again. Edit. They now have a ED version for $169 on Amazon. I would love to try these because if they are better they are awesome binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: P. S.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Campers!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I really enjoy camping, we go all the time. I just bought these for my him for Father's Day & he LOVES them! He says they are so much clearer & easier to adjust then any binoculars he's ever owned. They came with a nice case & 2 straps for the case & binos. He's very pleased and excited about his new gift, which made me a Happy Camper!!!
customer_reviews.author: vintagesusie

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars
customer_reviews.text: The binoculars are amazing for the price. Every adjustment you make is fluid, works beautifully allowing you a crystal clear viewing experience. Just really great. AND - the order showed up a day early. Thanks Amazon for my enhanced bird watching experience!
customer_reviews.author: Flowersnknuckleheads

customer_reviews.title: Had great memories with it
customer_reviews.text: Lost them and now I miss them. Had great memories with it. My first. My companion. Really miss you. You were the best from nature viewing to stargazing as well with able to mount on tripod. One thing though was when viewing close objects, like a bush, they appeared 2D like a paper. But didn't matter as mostly it was used for long regular viewing. Again all binoculars as I am coming to know suits particular need and no one is complete for all activities. At this price it was the best.
customer_reviews.author: ramkris444

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Close focusing binoculars allow viewing of insects, amphibians, reptiles and other things, clearly without disturbing them. A must for all households. Window to the world. These are not bad but image quality is not as good as more expensive ones. Still, fewer tears if I drop them in the lake. I'm rough on equipment, so any time I can get acceptable quality at a good price, it's a win.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W.

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: They work great, provide plenty of light and a crystal clear image but they are not at all waterproof. I took them on a boat where they got splashed, one lens immediately fogged up on the inside and they have not dried out after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great entry to birding
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my Mother who is getting into bird watching. She can't stop praising them. I tried them out and they give a very sharp and clear view. They feel well built and sturdy without being terribly heavy or overly huge. Focusing is smooth and easy. My Mom wears glasses and she hasn't had any issues using the Celestron binoculars with them on. This has made her bird watching much more enjoyable (she was raving about how she could "count the feathers" on one the other day). lol If you're getting into birding, these are an affordable alternative to the much more expensive binoculars out there. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: OK binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These are OK binoculars. Seemed a little small for my face. I compared them with the Vortex Crossfires which are about the same price and decided to go with the Vortex due to the optics being better iny opinion and also a better fit for my face.
customer_reviews.author: elnuttero

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to fault with these! They are well constructed and come with lens caps, sturdy case and straps. In hindsight, I should have bought the 10 x version as these are a little heavy and shaky hands are emphasised. But, I also bought the tripod adapter and solved that issue: .
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: All of my binocs are old and heavy, and I wanted something new for our Alaskan adventure. So, I decided on the Celestron Nature DX 8 x 32 and I think I made a very good choice. Love the durable materials they are made from, and love the clear sharp image they produce. They won't fog and they are water proof, plus they are easy to adjust. Just the perfect size for wearing around my neck, or carrying in my backpack. I really think they are very good for birding or hiking, and I might take them to our next Broadway series play!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: I love these binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: I love these binoculars! They replaced a very old pair that was much heavier and harder to deal with. These have great optics, are lightweight, and are comfortable and easy to hold. I plan to use them mainly for watching birds: My first trip using them was successful and rewarding. I thought the case was a little snug so instead I am using a different case I had around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Manley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, amazing performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, amazing performance for the money. I have owned the Vanguard 8x42s with ED glass and I don't even notice a difference. Those cost twice what these cost me and they go for even more now. The Celestrons are also extremely compact and light. I fully recommend these looking for a feature rich, compact binocular that is an amazing value.
customer_reviews.author: Stratos and Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 14 year daughter who has fallen in love w/bird watching. Well built, excellent glass and quality, viewable at close range. I've owned a couple celestron telescopes and they make a good product and these are ideas and not too big to hold.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. The 12X power is about the highest power I can effectively handhold, and tge 56mm is still fairly bright. Image is sharp and clear. Large ocular with long eye relief means they a great for people with glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Light, easily focused and “holds” settings well...
customer_reviews.text: Size is particularly impressive. Excellent clarity. Sued it during a Regatta and was able to spot boat location in lance as well as number of participants in various boat races. Range approximately 2000 meters!
customer_reviews.author: GJD1142

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my phone's camera
customer_reviews.text: I like these lenses that I can add to the camera on my phone. I am still learning to use them creatively! They are easy to use, and they come with a great storage case. For the money, you can't go wrong with these. I have a Galaxy S9+ phone.
customer_reviews.author: E. Withers

customer_reviews.title: I really like them. Work great with my glasses
customer_reviews.text: My bird professor approved these. I really like them. Work great with my glasses. Easy to get a good look at birds at a distance and close up. I replaced the terrible itchy strap they came with immediately. Not too heavy but still a good weight for clobbering strange men that get too close when I'm birding alone. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner bird watcher and I found that these binoculars are clear, easy to adjust and good quality. They are lightweight and easy to take on a hike. I do wish they had the kind of eye cups that my grandmother's binoculars had, but maybe I can find some to add to this pair. Great beginner set and a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Yacks

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these binoculars !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had binoculars this good. I can see the rings around the bird’s eye! These were recommended by the Audubon Association for birding. My old sports binoculars are nothing like these. Celestron lives up to its good name. And the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great for viewing wildlife.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an Alaskan cruise for viewing wildlife. Worker perfectly! Was able to spot bears and mountain goats with ease. Lightweight and easy to handle, fit my hands well. Glad I got them. My husband wouldn’t share!
customer_reviews.author: K. Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the product.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that a carrying case and neck strap is included should be mentioned in the advertisement. A pleasant surprise for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Collection Addition
customer_reviews.text: The Celestron Nature DX are the only binoculars I have. They have been great to use with glasses on and are a blend of reasonable cost, packability, and successful viewing. I use binoculars only occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: So Many Books...

customer_reviews.title: You Get Exactly What You Pay For (In A Good Way)
customer_reviews.text: The binoculars are exactly as described in the product description. They are a perfect medium in terms of size and capability. The view quality is excellent, and the parts and materials which make up the binoculars have a nice, quality feel. They come with a carrying case, a lens cloth, an instruction manual, a neck strap, and lens caps for both objective lenses and both eyepieces. If you happen to be looking for your first pair of reasonably priced, no-bullshit binoculars, as I was, then these might be your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love this pair - I've had a few different pairs ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this pair - I've had a few different pairs of binoculars so far, and I love to go birding - but this beats them all ....they are nice and bright. I needed a pair that wasn't too big or too heavy, that I could pack in with my camera, and this fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Great price for an awesome binocular
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an African safari. They are everything the information said they were and more. Very convenient to use. Light weight so my arms and neck weren't tired after hours of safari. Like the eye extenders!
customer_reviews.author: B. Harlow

customer_reviews.title: but still glad I got the larger one for viewing area
customer_reviews.text: Heavier feeling than I thought, but still glad I got the larger one for viewing area, easier to locate the moving birds! I've had a cheaper bird-watching binocular for yrs that my dad bought me. It did the job fine. It's a bit bulky to carry so I never took it anywhere but my backyard. This is more compact & is a step up in visual quality. Well made for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Smilestir

customer_reviews.title: All outdoors-persons should have these great binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: I've had many cheap binoculars before, but have never had a really good pair. Wow - I didn't know what I was missing! These are terrific binoculars, and they come with great lens covers for both ends that can be attached right to the neck strap so that you won't lose them and they are always handy. These are so good that I can't imagine why I would spend $1000 for a pair of binocs. Give them a try - I suspect these will be my "go to" binocs for the rest of my life. Or at least until I get bionic eyes!
customer_reviews.author: D. Ebben

customer_reviews.title: Decent pair of Binoculars 8x42
customer_reviews.text: The wife and I are new to bird watching and I wanted her to have a decent pair of binoculars. These have a very crisp image that gives viewing through them a Wow! factor. Got a deal on Prime day and saved a few bucks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Big V

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on binoculars and I think that I made the right choice. Used for bird watching in my back yard. Quality seems very good, the lift-up eye cups are great as a glasses wearer. Very bright and clear image, quick and easy to focus.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife. She loves them - she can find things easier with them than with the 10x50s we had. The close focus is so much better than our older pair! Great for birding or butterfly observing - or probably many other things. Clear, crisp optics. The objective lens covers are attached via a ring so they don't fall away, get lost ... suppose you could detach if you wanted to. Very happy with purchase. May have to get ME a pair now!
customer_reviews.author: Web Puddin

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Look good so far. Haven't a chance to use these outside of the house. Good quality, look good around the yard. I am impressed by the quality feel these have. I will update this rating at a later date if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Knows

customer_reviews.title: Right bins for right price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this very affordable pair of bins. Suffers from a poor strap and low light issues, but overall great image, good focusing wheel, durable yet light, Cornell was absolutely right to recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I live across from a state park and from my porch looking across the street I could see a bug climbing on a tree and all the intricate parts of the tree bark. I love these, and I would recommend them and I am glad I bought them, I watch all the birds and now the bugs too !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Great for Alaska outdoor viewing
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely not small, but they weigh less than other binoculars even smaller ones. They are easy to handle, and gave me great wide views of mountains, glaciers, and wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: scubac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust for beady eyes
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to adjust for beady eyes. They are also more light weight than most full size binoculars. As well, they aren't too bulky for small hands to use for an extended period of time. Excellent clarity for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki W.

customer_reviews.title: What are you missing?
customer_reviews.text: These are a great starter pair for birdwatching and general viewing. We have been able to identify alot of birds more clearly in our feeders and trees which is why we pullled the trigger to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: These. Are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: After reading glowing reviews from ornithological pubs, I picked these up and was NOT disappointed. Got two pairs for my daughter and I so we can hit the trails and birdwatch.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: ... a lot before purchasing I knew they were the best bang for my buck
customer_reviews.text: Met and exceeded expectations but after reading about them a lot before purchasing I knew they were the best bang for my buck. I was not disapponted and would recommend them to anyone. They are well made and not too heavy and great field of view and magnification. You wont find a better Binocular for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: The high quality is surprising for the price. My son has a pair of very expensive binoculars and these are quite comparable to his that cost 8 times more. Love the attached lens covers and a nice case was also included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first pair withstood excessive abuse for 10 years but performed admirably, until a grandchild dropped them off the deck.
customer_reviews.author: andropogon

customer_reviews.title: Perform like much higher priced binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid backyard birder and needed a new pair of binoculars. I read reviews of these in a birding blog so thought I would give them a try. The clarity is great, the adjustment is very nice and they are pretty lightweight to pack in a backpack. They appear to be very well made. I highly recommend these to anyone. Especially is you are looking for a less expensive binocular with good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Zornek-Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love these binocs. They're the perfect weight for hiking, and so much better than the comparable Nikon binocs I used to use--better optics, better quality, better everything.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K

customer_reviews.title: and the magnification was perfect for observing animals
customer_reviews.text: These performed very well during my Masai Mara safari in Kenya. Images were crisp, and the magnification was perfect for observing animals. They are full size, and feel sturdy. Not compact or light, but I was still able to pack them in my carry on, and travel with them just fine.
customer_reviews.author: mynomadlyfe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled by the price—quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I love the clear images and how the lens caps can be tethered. The product is made well. They are a little heavy (but that was disclosed in the description), but I think they are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Love the clarity. I have them for all round use like watching ildlife , birds and scenery at the cabin or exploring on the ATV. Have not had them long enough to say anything about durability but quality of the materials and clarity of these are amazing. Very hahhy I bought them, now take them everywhere
customer_reviews.author: watch nut

product_meta.title: Celestron – Nature DX 8x42 Binoculars – Outdoor and Birding Binocular – Fully Multi-coated with BaK-4 Prisms – Rubber Armored – Fog & Waterproof Binoculars – Top Pick Optics
product_meta.description: Style:8x42| Configuration:BinocularProudly created with US engineering, the Nature DX 8x42 reveals image detail you won’t find with other beginners’ binoculars. The fully multi-coated lenses provide maximum light transmission through the entire optical path, resulting in brighter, sharper images even in low light conditions. The high-quality BaK-4 prisms are phase-coated to increase the contrast and resolution. Nearby subjects like plants and insects are easy to view with a close focus of just 6.5 feet. These binoculars also allow the pursuit of distant subjects with 8x magnification and 42 mm objective lenses to easily acquire and follow your subject, no matter the distance. The Nature DX 8x42 body has been specifically designed to endure your travels thanks to its lightweight polycarbonate housing, which protects the binocular from damage. The binocular is 100 percent waterproof and purged with nitrogen gas to prevent internal fogging of the lenses in wet conditions. Rubber armor ensures durability, and the twist-up eyecups with multi-stop function allow for proper positioning of the eyes, even for eyeglass wearers! Buy with confidence from Celestron, based in California since 1960. Your purchase is backed by a Limited Lifetime warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts.
feature_bullets: PERFECT BINOCULARS FOR EVERY ADVENTURE: A great match for everyone from beginners to mid-range outdoors and birding enthusiasts. The perfect combination of premium build, portability, and price

TOP-RATED GLASS OPTICS WITH IMPRESSIVE SPECS: Fully multi-coated lenses for brighter images, more contrast and highest resolution with phase-coated BaK-4 prisms, 8x magnification power, and 6.5-foot close focus

ROBUST, WATERPROOF MID-SIZED BODY: Incredibly precise build and design that offers protection from outdoor elements. Features a waterproof/fogproof, rubber-armored, polycarbonate housing. Comfortable twist-up eyecups with multi-stop function ensure proper positioning of the eyes for eyeglass wearers and non-eyeglass wearers alike

ALL YOU NEED IS INCLUDED: Take this Binocular with you anywhere. We’ve included a compact carrying case, objective lens caps, an eyepiece rainguard, a neck strap, a lens cloth, and an instruction manual for easy use on the go

UNBEATABLE WARRANTY AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Buy with confidence from Celestron, a leading binocular and telescope brand, based in California since 1960. Your purchase is backed by a limited lifetime warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,405 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
